heaviest_rainfall.status: The heaviest total rainfall occurred on 04 January 2025, dropping 36.8mm of rain over the 37.2 hour storm duration with a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: Rain fell for 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 creating a new record that still lasts.  The storm produced a total of 36.8mm with a maximum intensity of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning activity recorded in a single day is 23, which occurred on 07 September 2025 (since our records began on 11 April 2025).

storm.status: Stormy conditions are expected.  This is the first storm in the region since 30 October 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: At the moment, it is not a cold snap.  This year has seen 6 cold snaps; typically, 3.7 cold snaps happen every year.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: At the moment, it is not a heatwaves.  This year has seen 6 heatwavess; typically, 1.9 heatwavess happen every year.

tropical.status: The previous tropical night was on 18 July 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (187°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: To date, the maximum wind gust recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1737 miles.

speed.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 6.0°C), outside temperature (up 4.8°C), and inside temperature (up 2.6°C) and more moisture-laden rainfall (up 0.3 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 289 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 433 m), feels like temperature (down 3.3°C), and dew point temperature (down 3.3°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 289.3m lower than yesterday, 335.8m lower than the past week, 433.3m lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 675m and a peak of 1900m, averaging 812.1m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should feel pleasantly mild. Outside; mild temperatures are expected. Also, air will feel comfortable and balanced and near calm conditions. Possible light showers, fog or low cloud is expected, and some sunny spells will occur. The weather may change rapidly and become worse.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (93%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
